title: Paloma Faith displays her kooky sense of style in a PVC neon green dress
text:
Paloma Faith upped the fashion stakes as she took to the stage in a kooky outfit for Finchatton's Twenty Grosvenor Square grand opening in London on Wednesday.

The singer, 38, ensured all eyes were on her as she sauntered around in an eye-catching neon green PVC dress.

Paloma partied with the likes of Lady Amelia Windsor, Jeremy Irvine and Imogen Waterhouse at the housing development launch.

Quirky: Paloma Faith upped the fashion stakes as she took to the stage in a kooky outfit for the Finchatton's Twenty Grosvenor Square grand opening in London on Wednesday

The green floor-length dress, which was partially sheer, sheathed Paloma's slender figure.

The songstress amped up the glamour with gem embellished heels, a dazzling silver necklace and matching earrings.

Slicking her blonde hair back off of her face and into a high bun, Paloma added an extra stylish flair to her ensemble with a pale pink hair bow.

Green with envy: The singer, 38, ensured all eyes were on her as she sauntered around in an eye-catching neon green PVC floor length dress

Born showgirl: At one point she held her hand to her ear to encourage the crowd to sing her smash hits

Vocal powerhouse: Flanked by backing singers and a live band, Paloma appeared in her element as she entertained the VIP guests with her music

Flanked by backing singers and a live band, Paloma appeared in her element as she entertained the VIP guests with her music.

At one point she held her hand to her ear to encourage the crowd to sing her smash hits.

Imogen Waterhouse, 25, was also at the bash and flashed a hint of her toned abs in a black crop top and high-waisted mom jeans.

Vibrant display: The green dress, which was partially sheer, sheathed Paloma's slender figure

Having a blast: Paloma partied with the likes of Lady Amelia Windsor, Jeremy Irvine and Imogen Waterhouse at the housing development launch

Style queen: The songstress amped up the glamour with gem embellished heels, a dazzling silver necklace and matching earrings

Cute: Slicking her blonde hair back off of her face and into a high bun, Paloma added an extra stylish flair to her ensemble with a pale pink hair bow

She teamed the look with black military boots and shrugged a light-weight brown coat over her shoulders.

Lady Amelia Windsor, 24, looked effortlessly demure in a blueberry print smock dress, which she accessorised with pink mules and a green handbag.

Tamara Beckwith, 49, meanwhile, looked every inch the fashion maven in a black silk suit.

Imogen Waterhouse, 25, flashed a hint of her toned abs in a black crop top and high-waisted mom jeans

She teamed the look with black military boots and shrugged a light-weight brown coat over her shoulders

Paloma's return to singing comes after she promoted her Batman prequel Pennyworth, in which she plays villain Bet Sykes.

The New York hitmaker recently revealed that her new role as vicious villain Bet Sykes in the prequel has impacted how she interacts with her neighbours, and not in a good way.

Speaking to The Mirror, the singer revealed an unfortunate run-in she had: 'I recently got into an argument with my next-door neighbour and told him I was gonna kill his dog.

Lady Amelia Windsor, 24, looked effortlessly demure in a blueberry print smock dress, which she accessorised with pink mules and a green handbag

Tamara Beckwith, 49, meanwhile, looked every inch the fashion maven in a black silk suit

Lady in red: Jackie St Clair was dressed to impress in a red mididress and slogan fascinator

Sophisticated party: Eric Underwood and Tamara Beckwith enjoyed a glass of wine at the reception

'And I realised afterwards that I hadn’t got out of ­character yet, and that’s not really my natural behaviour.'

Going on to say she's 'creating bad relations with people' who live near her, she added: 'People keep coming up to me on the set saying, "I’m scared of you. It’s too real, and we’re really worried."'

The series is based around Bob Kane and Bill Finger’s DC characters and will follow Bruce Wayne’s iconic butler Alfred Pennyworth.

Mamma Mia! Jeremy Irvine, Kaya Scodelario and Hugh Skinner (L-R) posed for a snap

Set in London, in the 1960s, the show will follow the former British SAS soldier as he creates a security company and goes to work with young billionaire Thomas Wayne - future father to the man behind Batman.

It won’t be Paloma’s first spin in the film world, with her onscreen credits including Peter & Wendy and Doctor Parnassus.

The ten episode series will air in the UK later this autumn.
description: The singer, 38, ensured all eyes were on her as she sauntered around in an eye-catching neon green PVC dress at Finchatton's Twenty Grosvenor Square grand opening in London on Wednesday
